page.title: 05 Life in Chartham Hatch (3)
page.content: The ladies of the village hall committee were trying to put together a history of the village hall.There were quite a few houses in the area with their own swimming pools. A playgroup and a ladies keep fit group were held in the village hall. A patchwork quilt was being made by all the ladies of the village hall committee.This would be raffled for the fund to maintain and improve the hall.There had been a Michaelmas Fair in the hall to raise money for the disabled.On Easter Monday there was a pram race organised by the villagers. Pilgrims still used the Pilgrims Way or North Downs Way.A few years back an old lady on horseback had ridden through the village following the ancient track.There were a lot of tourists and hikers still using the path.
